results.title: Australian vintage
results.creator_credit: Peter Thompson, Australian Wine and Brandy Corporation and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This film explores the development of the wine industry in Australia with particular reference to Australia’s international status as a wine producing country. Features an appearance by winemaker and writer Len Evans.

results.title: Toronto jazz
results.creator_credit: Don Owen, Roman Kroitor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Toronto is regarded as the third largest jazz centre in North America. This film features a cross-section of jazz bands of that city: the Lenny Breau Trio, the Don Thompson Quintet and the Alf Jones Quartet. Their styles show creative self-expression, hard work, and improvisation.

results.title: Spread your wings: making it with TAFE
results.creator_credit: John O'Shea, Chris Stewart, Documentary Films and Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: An impressionistic film which is intended to provide information about the opportunities offered by Technical and Further Education in vocational training, and in recreational courses to meet community requirements. It is not intended to give detailed information on the breadth of courses and curricula but is rather a stimulus film aimed at encouraging enrolment.

results.title: Evaluation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Depicts a school that takes its evaluation seriously. Keeping in touch with its community has required constant monitoring and some innovative adjustments. Staff, curriculum, in service and Supplementary Grants meetings are now one and the same and are occasions where parents and teachers learn together.

results.title: Indonesia: an Alternative Lifestyle
results.creator_credit: Leigh Tilson and Experimental Film and Television Fund
results.brief_description: A non-narrated film that contrasts behind-the-scenes life in both rural and urban Indonesia with the view of the country as seen by foreign tourists.

results.title: In the Wake of the Stars
results.creator_credit: Mark McDonald, Walter Batty, Bede Whiteman and Cinesound
results.brief_description: Aviation came quickly in Australia. In the early days reliable DC3’s carried everyone and everything. Then new faster and more comfortable aircraft were sought: the Fokker Friendship from Holland, the super Viscount from France and turbo jets from America. During training flights the attractions of gracious Amsterdam, gay Paris, England’s spring, New York’s people, Rome’s buildings and Australia’s scenic attractions are presented.

results.title: Community College Mt Gambier: growing
results.creator_credit: Justin Milne, New Films and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This is the story of the South East Community College Mount Gambier. Features two teachers, Bev Puckridge and Ian Winter, who narrate throughout the film. Shows how students go back to their own communities and set up and teach smaller groups in woodwork, pottery, spinning etc. Emphasis is made that art is a natural part of our world - a natural thing to do. It is not the finished product that really matters, but the thought process used to achieve it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Justin Milne, New Films and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: In partnership with the people
results.creator_credit: John M. Bale and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production
results.brief_description: Battery Point is one of the oldest parts of Hobart and the City Council is about to put into practice a development plan which will retain the character and charm of this area. Shows the signal station, the seamen’s cottages, the fine houses of the wealthy, Kelly’s Steps, St George’s Church and other historic items.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John M. Bale and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production

results.title: Dream
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description: A partly animated film based on a series of drypoint prints (‘Movements’ and ‘Combats’) by Australian printmaker Charles Lloyd on the theme of aggression in society. The sound composition by Arthur Cantrill is a mix of percussion and altered piano (plucking and hitting strings and soundboard, played by Arthur Cantrill), sound effects (including breathing), and electronically modified children’s laughter, recorded on a Nagra reel to reel tape recorder and transferred to 16mm magnetic tracks which were laid and mixed in a professional sound studio, where reverberation was added to some sections.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: Beard and bass
results.brief_description: An experimental short film about a bearded young man and a double bass. Clasping the instrument he tries to cross a street. Suddenly his attention is arrested by a girl whose charms he appreciates. She smiles at him and crosses the street. He stares at her and then realising suddenly that she has disappeared, he props up his double bass against the tree and disappears into the crowd. Music by George Dreyfus, edited by Peter Tammer.
